title: Street vendors’ agitation today
content:
Comment  ·  print ·  T  T 

T+·  T- 

Street vendors in Delhi will stage a protest outside Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s residence on Wednesday, as no steps have been taken to implement the Street Vendors Protection Act. 

The National Association of Street Vendors of India (NASVI) will organise the protest along with other vendors’ bodies. 

“The AAP government has not taken any steps to implement the Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Act, 2014. The Delhi government is not issuing licence to the street vendors,” said Arbind Singh, national coordinator, NASVI. 

“Over five lakh vendors have not been issued licence despite the Act passed by Parliament on March 5, 2014.”
